headline: Verizon Turnaround Watch As Fiber Deal And Net Adds Reframe Valuation
summary: Verizon Communications (NYSE:VZ) reported its strongest quarterly net additions in mobility and broadband since 2019. The company closed its acquisition of Frontier's fiber assets, a major move for its broadband footprint. New CEO Dan Schulman highlighted synergy targets and a positive outlook for 2026 as part of a broader turnaround plan. For investors watching NYSE:VZ, the latest update ties together subscriber momentum and a larger push into fiber. The stock last closed at $39.81, with a...

headline: Verizon (VZ) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: The Verizon brand was built on superior network quality and reliability, and I'm committed to relentlessly working to deliver the service that our customers expect and deserve each and every day.  In response to the winter storm, I want to thank our technicians, fiber crews and retail teams who have battled the ice and snow to serve our customers and keep them connected.

headline: Verizon Posts Strong Subscriber Gains Under New CEO
summary: Verizon Communications  gained a net 616,000 postpaid phone connections in the fourth quarter, with its chief executive calling the period a “critical inflection point.”  Dan Schulman  took over as chief executive officer of the nation’s largest wireless carrier in October with a mandate to execute cost cuts and a strategic turnaround after it lost ground to rivals.  This month he faced a major test as millions of Verizon customers lost service during an hourslong network outage.

raw.headline: Verizon Posts Strong Subscriber Gains Under New CEO
raw.summary: Verizon Communications  gained a net 616,000 postpaid phone connections in the fourth quarter, with its chief executive calling the period a “critical inflection point.”  Dan Schulman  took over as chief executive officer of the nation’s largest wireless carrier in October with a mandate to execute cost cuts and a strategic turnaround after it lost ground to rivals.  This month he faced a major test as millions of Verizon customers lost service during an hourslong network outage.

headline: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Beats Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations
summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 2% year on year to $36.38 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.09 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Beats Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations

headline: Verizon: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The New York-based company said it had net income of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for severance costs and non-recurring costs, came to $1.09 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Verizon: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The New York-based company said it had net income of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for severance costs and non-recurring costs, came to $1.09 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Verizon forecasts upbeat annual profit as wireless subscriber growth hits six-year high
summary: Verizon forecast annual profit and free cash flow above market expectations on Friday, as aggressive promotions during peak holiday ​period helped the U.S. carrier post its highest quarterly wireless subscriber ‌additions in six years. Shares of the company rose 4% in premarket trading. In the fourth quarter, ‌telecom operators often rely on device promotions and bundled plans to poach customers looking to switch carriers amid peak phone-buying during Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals.

Shares of the company rose 4% in premarket trading. In the fourth quarter, ‌telecom operators often rely on device promotions and bundled plans to poach customers looking to switch carriers amid peak phone-buying during Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals.

headline: Stock Index Futures Slip as Trump Picks Warsh for Fed Chair

headline: Does Verizon’s ESOP Share Filing and Frontier Deal Oversight Reshape Its Utility-Like Profile (VZ)?
summary: Verizon Communications recently filed a shelf registration for 750,000 common shares valued at about US$29.18 million for an ESOP-related offering, while contending with tighter regulation tied to its US$20.00 billion Frontier fiber acquisition and ongoing competitive pressure in wireless. Analysts increasingly describe Verizon as a high-yield, bond-like telecom utility with heavy debt and limited flexibility, highlighting how dividend commitments and regulatory obligations may constrain its...
